basic_info.description: üëã My name is Sebastian Koller. I am an ambitious web and mobile developer with extensive experience in Flutter, React, React Native, and Nest.js. I am always open to new experiences and insights, and I love to learn. Besides my programming projects, I enjoy working with my 3D printer, taking care of my numerous plants, and spending time with my cat. If you want to know more about me or my work, feel free to contact me at me@sebastiankoller.at.

projects.title: Master‚Äôs Thesis - CI/CD
projects.description:
CI/CD for React Native ‚Äì turning ‚Äúworks on my machine‚Äù into reproducible releases

I built an end-to-end CI/CD pipeline for a cross-platform React Native app (iOS & Android). Goal: reliable builds, automated testing, and one-click delivery to TestFlight/Play Console ‚Äî without manual firefighting.

  • Stack: GitHub Actions (CI), Fastlane (CD), Jest (unit/integration), Detox (GUI/E2E), ESLint, semantic versioning
  • Workflows: split iOS/Android pipelines with lint ‚Üí tests ‚Üí build ‚Üí artifacts ‚Üí release
  • E2E tests: Detox covers critical flows; Android on a self-hosted runner for stability/speed, iOS there as well (Apple constraints)
  • Observability: metrics & artifacts (build status, coverage, durations) curated for devs and PM

Impact

  • Release confidence: reproducible, auditable, versioned
  • Debug time ‚Üì via reproducible local runs and targeted caching (avoiding Gradle flakiness)
  • Fewer manual errors: pipeline fails early ‚Äî not during store review

Measured

  • 174 CI test runs (~2075 min ‚âà 35h) during stabilization
  • 19 release runs (~168 min); moving Android E2E to self-hosted runner removed major flakes

My role

  • Designed & implemented the entire pipeline (workflows, Fastlane lanes, Detox setup, SemVer)
  • Shifted quality into the process: linting, tests, artifacts, dashboards ‚Äî before store upload

Outcome: A robust release chain that turns code changes into fast testable builds and store-ready releases.

projects.title: Murder Menu ‚Äì SS25
projects.description:
CI/CD, Testing & New Stories (SS25)

Summer 2025: Two more user tests (incl. Masterclass) focusing on stability, comprehension and pacing. In parallel, TFG calls produced two new stories incl. characters, hints and animations by five contributors, prepared for integration. As part of my master‚Äôs thesis I introduced CI/CD and testing to professionalize the release path.

Engineering

  • CI/CD with GitHub Actions: builds, checks, artifacts; foundation for App/Play store pipelines
  • Automated tests: FE/BE tests + reproducible evaluation from user tests
  • Stabilization/observability: refinements based on WS24 insights

User Research

  • Masterclass test: full dinner flow under realistic conditions
  • Second external test: validated onboarding, role booklets, phase timing
  • Evaluation pipeline unchanged: time-stamped notes ‚Üí CSV/Python ‚Üí Notion ‚Üí GitHub issues

Content Scaling

  • 2 new modules (story/chars/hints/anims); sharpened briefs & technical guidelines for future contributors

My Learnings (Sebastian)

  • Pipeline thinking: quality comes from process (CI/CD, tests, monitoring), not heroics
  • Scaling content: without clear guidelines (structure, interfaces, file formats, QA) rework explodes
  • Measurability: reproducible pipelines make progress objective ‚Äì less gut feel, more data

Outlook from SS25

  • Integrate the new stories; more group tests
  • Polish & push notifications
  • Goal: stable multi-module release for App Store & Play Store

projects.title: Time Parabox
projects.description: Time Parabox is a hybrid escape game that combines a physical puzzle box with a React Native mobile app. Created by a team of ten students, the game takes players on a journey through different historical eras. My contribution focused on connecting the ESP32 microcontroller to the app via Bluetooth Low Energy. I worked on the integration of BLE into the React Native app and helped ensure the interaction between digital riddles and physical locks worked smoothly. Phone Mockup by Feepik.

projects.title: Murder Menu ‚Äì WS24
projects.description:
In-App Purchases, Story Overhaul & First Full Test (WS24)

Third term, aiming for product readiness: In-app purchases via RevenueCat (centralized Apple/Google), distribution through TestFlight & Play Console for external testers. Story was fully reworked (closed gaps, created role booklets); long-form reading UIs with slider (phases) & accordion (role info). Backend hardening: Portainer for container ops, BetterStack + Telegram alerts for logging, Swagger for API docs.

User Test (23 Feb 2025)

  • 8 participants, full dinner run (17:00‚Äì21:00)
  • Live observations via WhatsApp (timestamps), audio/video capture
  • Evaluation pipeline: WhatsApp ‚Üí Python/CSV ‚Üí Notion (categorize/prioritize) ‚Üí CSV ‚Üí automated GitHub issues (GitHub Projects)
  • SUS 86.1 (very good); ~‚Ç¨20 willingness to pay; 50% of experienced players prefer the app over analog; story/roles good with concrete suggestions

Milestones

  • Admitted to Creative Pre-Incubator (FH St. P√∂lten)
  • 1st place at the project vernissage (category)

My Learnings (Sebastian)

  • Release chain end-to-end: ASC/Play Console, external tester groups, TestFlight invites ‚Äì lots of ops, huge leverage
  • Ops/observability matter: Portainer + BetterStack + Telegram reduce blind spots; critical errors become visible fast
  • Story reality: A coherent 8-role crime story is systems engineering ‚Äì visualize, close gaps, balance workload
  • Mindset: abandoning ‚Äúperfect before test‚Äù accelerates progress via real feedback

Outlook from WS24

  • Bug fixes, UX improvements, push notifications
  • More content; prepare a multi-module release

projects.title: Environmental Storytelling
projects.description: In the Environmental Storytelling workshop during the 2024 Summer School week, we had to integrate a story into an environment. We chose a murder scene and incorporated many elements inspired by the events of the Manson Family and the murder of Sharon Tate. During the project, we deepened our Unity skills and worked on the assets using Blender and Photoshop.

projects.title: Murder Menu ‚Äì SS24
projects.description:
MVP Expansion, Content & Session Management (SS24)

Second milestone: The MVP became a usable app. Registration & login (incl. verification & password reset) are robust, module ‚Äúpurchase‚Äù (no payment yet) with game planning (date/time/location) & invite codes is implemented. Session management via WebSockets (Socket.io) keeps participants in sync (status/voting) and blocks progress until everyone is ready. TFG content (story, graphics, animations) is integrated in a production-like pipeline.

Content Pipeline

  • Graphics/Lottie served via nginx Docker on our server (instead of Firebase) ‚Üí control & reproducible deployments
  • Lottie integration incl. native logo splash (Obj-C/Swift/Kotlin) due to missing RN package

User Research

  • Project vernissage quick test: registration ‚Üí prototype walk-through ‚Üí SUS 85.56 (excellent) and 37 beta signups

Outlook from SS24

  • Fully load the story into the DB and optimize reading screens for long text
  • Larger end-to-end user test; use App/Play developer accounts; prepare real purchases

My Learnings (Sebastian)

  • Auth reality: verification/reset/error cases are complex but core to trust
  • Architecture choice: owning assets via nginx+Docker buys stability & independence
  • Tooling/integrations: After Effects ‚Üí Lottie; deeper Socket.io & FE/BE contracts
  • Scope estimation: our ‚Äû70‚Äì80%‚Äú was actually ~20‚Äì30%; planning adjusted

projects.title: Ant Calculator
projects.description: The Ant Calculator was the initial project of the Mobile Master's class. The topic was 'print-to-mobile,' where you had to link a printed QR code to a digital product. The idea for the app came from a conversation with friends, and I used the project to refresh my Flutter skills.

projects.title: Murder Menu ‚Äì WS23
projects.description:
Kickoff, Prototype & MVP (WS23)

Murder Menu is an interactive dinner-and-crime app guiding a full murder mystery dinner: one host purchases a module, invites players, roles are assigned, multi-phase clues (simulated messages, videos, photos, police reports) are revealed, followed by voting & resolution. In the first term we focused on a design prototype and a functional MVP covering Introduction, Flow, and Resolution, while putting a scalable architecture and project structure in place.

Tech & Architecture

  • Frontend: React Native; Redux for state; initial screens & flows
  • Backend: NestJS (base API), MongoDB document DB
  • Deployment: Docker image for backend; running on server incl. DB
  • Project Management: GitHub Projects (boards, issues, milestones)
  • Architecture Docs: PlantUML diagrams (first pass at formal architecture)

MVP Content

  • Guided Introduction (onboarding into the game)
  • Phase-based Flow (clues/media step by step)
  • Resolution with voting

Dev & Pain Points

  • Smaller team at start ‚Üí re-scoped to core functionality
  • First end-to-end deployment (Docker, server, DB) without prior experience ‚Üí iterations & troubleshooting
  • Redux learning curve: actions/reducers/store
  • Stubborn dev setup (Xcode/Simulator/Cocoapods/Node): root causes via dotfiles (.zshrc) & Xcode settings

Outlook from WS23

  • Session management (instead of DB-driven phase state)
  • Richer clues; optional notes & in-game chat
  • Stronger usability focus via real user testing

My Learnings (Sebastian)

  • Deployment from zero: connecting GitHub + Docker, building images, running on server
  • Productizing new stacks: first hands-on with React Native & NestJS; build only what the MVP needs
  • Process: GitHub Projects as the PM backbone; less procrastination due to long-term personal motivation

projects.title: INGO
projects.description: INGO is a project that I worked on with seven fellow students during the Bachelor's media technology project semester. Over six months, we developed an app using Flutter, Express.js, and Prisma, which allows users to manage their finances. The project was a key milestone in my career path, where I learned a lot about teamwork, project management, and app development. Unfortunately, the app is no longer available in stores, and the website is also inactive.

projects.title: Bachelor Thesis Unity
projects.description: For my Bachelor's thesis, I developed a prototype in Unity. The aim was to evaluate Unity's capabilities for developing VR applications for educational purposes. In the prototype, the player is the size of a butterfly to experience the lifecycle of a butterfly up close.

projects.title: Automated Watering System
projects.description: My most complex 3D printing project was a control system for an automated watering system. I completed the project for two courses during my Bachelor's degree. I learned a lot about microcontrollers and electronics and was able to deepen my 3D printing skills.

experience.title: Civil Service: Patient and Ambulance Transport
